CatDescriptText: Ira Kellum, crane operator, 3330 McNeil Place, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "A graduated income tax is better, in this way, everybody will be paying where as with the sales tax the state would miss some income because a lot of people do not buy things like cigarettes and alcoholic drinks, which are taxable. By a graduated income tax, the responsibility of supporting the state will teach everybody and will be fair."
TitMainTitle: Ira Kellum wearing light colored hat and coat, standing with hands in pockets, standing next to boy wearing cap with fur flaps, in front of store with sign in window reading "Faber Coe & Gregg of Penna. Inc." and advertisement for Antonio y Cleopatra cigars, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
